CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;Violation of P4-2;Non-pecuniary damage - award;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed
JUDGES: Alvina Gyulumyan;Corneliu Bîrsan;Egbert Myjer;Elisabet Fura;Ineta Ziemele;Josep Casadevall
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE , GPE . At the time of the events he was living in GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE , DATE the NORP police took a statement from the applicant in connection with criminal complaints lodged against him by his business partners concerning alleged fraud .
CARDINAL . On DATE criminal proceedings against the applicant were opened and he was placed in police custody on charges of fraud through his business transactions .
DATE , the prosecutor attached to ORG ordered the applicant 's remand in custody .
CARDINAL . On DATE the prosecutor attached to ORG committed the applicant for trial before ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG held the first hearing in the case . The applicant 's lawyer asked for a rescheduling in order to prepare the defence . Several other hearings were scheduled for the taking of evidence . On several occasions ORG postponed the case due to shortcomings in the summoning procedure .
On DATE a witness 's testimony was heard , in the presence of the applicant and his lawyer .

CARDINAL . In a judgment of CARDINAL DATE , ORG convicted the applicant of fraud , sentenced him to DATE imprisonment and awarded civil damages to the victims . It also ordered the applicant 's expulsion , after having served the sentence , given his NORP nationality .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG allowed an appeal by the applicant and remitted the case to ORG for a new trial on the merits . It found that the court of first instance had not clarified all the relevant facts and that it had not examined all the charges against the applicant , as formulated by the prosecutor on DATE .

CARDINAL . DATE and DATE some forty hearings were scheduled before ORG , the case being repeatedly adjourned for failure to properly summon the parties , the absence of the parties or the absence of the prosecution file . On DATE the case was adjourned in order to allow the applicant to hire a new lawyer .
The applicant filed motions for bias against the judges of ORG on DATE , DATE and CARDINAL DATE . They were all dismissed .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , after reassessing the evidence adduced in the case , again convicted and sentenced the applicant to DATE imprisonment , with an obligation to pay civil damages .

CARDINAL . On DATE , upon an appeal by the applicant , ORG ended the trial , as the criminal charges against the applicant had become time - barred . After reassessing the evidence and based on its findings , ORG recalculated the amount of civil damages to be awarded to the victims .
CARDINAL . In a final decision of DATE , ORG , after reassessing the evidence in the case , dismissed an appeal on points of law by the applicant against the decision of DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG lodged an application with ORG to have the part of the final decision of DATE concerning the expulsion order quashed ( recurs în anulare ) .

In a final decision of DATE , ORG allowed the extraordinary appeal , quashed the part of the final decision of DATE concerning the expulsion order and set aside that order on the ground that the applicant had never lost his NORP citizenship , which would make his expulsion unconstitutional .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , upon the applicant 's request , revoked the order for his arrest , but imposed on him an obligation not to leave the city , a precautionary measure provided for by LAW ( the “ ORG ” ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged with ORG a request to have this prohibition revoked . He argued that , if allowed to travel abroad for business purposes , the funds to pay the damages could be recovered more quickly . In a decision delivered on DATE , ORG dismissed the request . It held that it was not necessary for the conduct of his business that the applicant travel abroad or to another town , since he could appoint a representative .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed an appeal by the applicant against this decision . It held that , according to the ORG , the applicant could only challenge the prohibition when appealing against the decision on the merits of the case .

CARDINAL . On DATE and DATE , DATE and DATE ORG rejected further requests from the applicant to have the measure lifted , without specifying reasons . On DATE ORG rejected a similar request on the ground that the circumstances that had led to the taking of the measure had not changed .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant left GPE of his own free will and took up residence in GPE .
